subclusters.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
Mesenchymal Stem Cell Exhaustion in Metabolic and Aging Diseases
Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
Stem Cell-Derived Extracellular Vesicle microRNA Regulation Theory
Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stem cell pool quantity and quality, homeostatic feedback, and signaling (e.g., gap junctions) controlling stem cell function and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on stem cell exhaustion affecting progenitor supply-demand balance and tissue growth, linking stem cell pool dynamics to aging and cancer risk.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes Notch signaling regulation of germline stem cell maintenance and exhaustion driving reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes adult Sox2+ stem cell exhaustion causing systemic aging, highlighting stem cell pool depletion and signaling roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links cell cycle regulator Cdk7 loss to adult stem cell exhaustion and premature aging, focusing on proliferative signaling and stem cell pool maintenance.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses stem cell pool quantity and quality, asymmetric vs symmetric division, and environmental/dietary influences on stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SOX transcription factors regulating stem cell maintenance and exhaustion driving aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Pool Homeostasis and Signaling Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes decline in stem cell number/function causing tissue degeneration and rejuvenation by stem cell supplementation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mesenchymal Stem Cell Exhaustion in Metabolic and Aging Diseases
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes MSC exhaustion as a fundamental cause of aging, metabolic syndrome, and related diseases, emphasizing MSC mobilization and depletion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mesenchymal Stem Cell Exhaustion in Metabolic and Aging Diseases
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details intrinsic and extrinsic aging of MSCs, their heterogeneity, and their role as mediators and subjects of systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mesenchymal Stem Cell Exhaustion in Metabolic and Aging Diseases
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes loss of regenerative capacity in somatic stem cells including MSCs, driven by intrinsic/extrinsic factors and senescence-associated secretory phenotype.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on limited replicative capacity of stem cells, accumulation of molecular damage (ROS, DNA), and genetic regulation of self-renewal.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes finite replicative potential of stem cells and its impact on tissue renewal and pathological aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes cell division number and replicative senescence as drivers of stem cell exhaustion and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes hematopoietic stem cell aging driven by increased proliferation, DNA damage accumulation, and cell cycle dysregulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA and oxidative damage accumulation in HSCs, apoptosis/senescence, and selection within stem cell pools.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights Notch/Wnt dysregulation, DNA damage accumulation, and compensatory proliferation in stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes intrinsic stem cell damage accumulation, niche effects, and tumor suppressor pathways causing stem cell functional decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genetic control of stem cell number/function, DNA damage accumulation, and links to organismal longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Replicative Capacity and Molecular Damage Exhaustion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses stem cell decline, clonal selection, epigenetic regulation, and tumor suppressor pathways in aging and cancer.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell-Derived Extracellular Vesicle microRNA Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stem cell-derived extracellular vesicles and miRNAs regulating cellular senescence, telomere maintenance, and stem cell exhaustion.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell-Derived Extracellular Vesicle microRNA Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes intrinsic and extrinsic factors regulating stem cell aging and rejuvenation strategies targeting stem cells and their niche.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell-Derived Extracellular Vesicle microRNA Regulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explores metabolic mechanisms of stem cell maintenance, mitochondrial roles, and evolutionary rationale for stem cell aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes preferential targeting and injury of tissue stem cells by diseases (COVID-19, GVHD) and age-related decline in stem cell function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed cell death, ROS signaling, and regulatory feedback loops causing stem cell loss in plant aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Models stem and progenitor cell regulation, quiescence, and division modes affecting aging and development in mammary gland.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes aging as non-regulated process driven by metabolic damage accumulation leading to exhaustion of biological systems.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stem Cell Damage and Targeting in Disease and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial dysfunction causing somatic cell depletion and lifespan limitation via cellular stress resistance.
